questions.question: If Y = a+b<sub>YX</sub>X and X = a'+b<sub>XY</sub>Y be the two regression lines then the correlation between X and Y(r) can be given as :
For the two regression lines of Y on X and X on Y respectively, if the regression coefficient b<sub>YX</sub> and b<sub>XY</sub> both are positive then:

answers.d: correlation coefficient equals to ratio of regression coefficients

questions.question: If b<sub>XY</sub> > 1 then b<sub>YX</sub> should be :
In the least square regression, which of the following is not an assumption about the error term?

answers.a: the expected value of error term is 1
answers.b: the variance of error terms is same for all values of x
answers.d: the error term is normally distributed

questions.question: If r is the correlation coefficient between X and Y then r<sup>2</sup> is
In a regression analysis if r<sup>2</sup>=1 then,

answers.b: SSE must be equal to zero
answers.d: SSE can be any positive value

answers.a: displays residuals of the dependent variable versus residuals of independent variable
answers.b: residuals of independent variable versus the dependent variable
answers.c: independent variable versus residual of the dependent variable

questions.question: When the error terms have constant variance then the residual plot shows the pattern :

answers.d: that forms a horizontal band pattern
